context_bundle.summary: Timeout handling: Prevent indefinite waits. Types: Connection timeout (establish connection), Read timeout (receive response), Operation timeout (complete task). Patterns: Set reasonable timeouts (API calls 10-30s, DB queries 5-10s, batch jobs 1h), implement retries with backoff, fail fast. Languages: Python (requests timeout=10), JavaScript (AbortController, Promise.race), Java (SocketTimeoutException), Go (context.WithTimeout). Best practices: Always set timeouts (never infinite wait), use context propagation, log timeout events, alert on high timeout rates. Debugging: Check network latency, slow dependencies, resource exhaustion.

onboarding.quick_start: Timeout handling: Limit wait time. Python (requests): import requests; try: response = requests.get('https://api.example.com', timeout=10); except requests.Timeout: print('Request timed out after 10 seconds'); # Handle timeout. JavaScript (fetch + AbortController): const controller = new AbortController(); const timeoutId = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), 10000); try { const response = await fetch(url, {signal: controller.signal}); } catch (err) { if (err.name === 'AbortError') { console.log('Request timed out'); } } finally { clearTimeout(timeoutId); }. Go (context): ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 10*time.Second); defer cancel(); req, _ := http.NewRequestWithContext(ctx, 'GET', url, nil); resp, err := client.Do(req); if err != nil { if ctx.Err() == context.DeadlineExceeded { // Timeout } }. Database (SQLAlchemy): engine = create_engine(url, pool_pre_ping=True, connect_args={'connect_timeout': 5}). Best practices: Set timeouts on all I/O (HTTP, DB, file), use shorter timeouts for health checks (1-2s), longer for batch operations (minutes), retry with exponential backoff.
common_patterns: Python requests: response = requests.post(url, json=data, timeout=(5, 10)) # (connect timeout, read timeout)
JavaScript Promise.race: const timeout = new Promise((_, reject) => setTimeout(() => reject(new Error('Timeout')), 10000)); const response = await Promise.race([fetch(url), timeout]);
Python asyncio: async with asyncio.timeout(10): result = await fetch_data(); # Python 3.11+
Go context: ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(ctx, 30*time.Second); defer cancel(); select { case result := <-doWork(ctx): return result; case <-ctx.Done(): return ctx.Err(); }
Database query timeout (PostgreSQL): SET statement_timeout = '5s'; SELECT * FROM large_table;
Redis timeout: redis_client = redis.Redis(host='localhost', socket_connect_timeout=2, socket_timeout=5)
gRPC timeout: ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 10*time.Second); resp, err := client.Method(ctx, req); # Timeout propagates
Health check timeout: Short timeout for liveliness (1-2s), longer for readiness (5-10s). If timeout, mark unhealthy.
Retry on timeout: for i in range(3): try: response = requests.get(url, timeout=10); break; except requests.Timeout: if i == 2: raise; time.sleep(2**i); # Exponential backoff
